text.div:
Generated Narrative: StructureDefinition Immunization-twcore

NameFlagsCard.TypeDescription & Constraints
Immunization C0..*Immunization疫苗接種
Constraints: tw-core-10
implicitRules 0..1uri創建此內容所依據的一組規則
modifierExtension 0..*Extension擴充內容可能會改變資源解釋方式
status S1..1codecompleted | entered-in-error | not-done
statusReason S0..1CodeableConcept接種未完成的原因
vaccineCode SC1..1CodeableConcept疫苗產品類型 (綁定到 CVX 疫苗代碼系統)
Binding: VaccineAdministeredValueSet (extensible)
patient S1..1Reference(TW Core Patient)接種疫苗的病患
encounter S0..1Reference(TW Core Encounter)與疫苗接種相關的就醫事件
occurrence[x] S1..1疫苗接種的發生日期/時間
occurrenceDateTimedateTime S
occurrenceStringstring
primarySource S0..1boolean資料來源是否為主要來源
location S0..1Reference(TW Core Location)疫苗接種的地點
manufacturer 0..1Reference(TW Core Organization)疫苗製造商
performer
actor 1..1Reference(TW Core Practitioner | TW Core PractitionerRole | TW Core Organization)執行疫苗接種的人員或組織
reasonReference 0..*Reference(TW Core Condition | TW Core Observation Clinical Result | TW Core DiagnosticReport)接種疫苗的原因
isSubpotent S0..1boolean疫苗效價是否低於標準
reaction
detail 0..1Reference(TW Core Observation Clinical Result)接種後反應的細節
protocolApplied
authority 0..1Reference(TW Core Organization)疫苗接種計劃的權責組織

Documentation for this format

name: TWCoreImmunization
title: TW Core Immunization
description: 此臺灣核心-疫苗接種 (TW Core Immunization) Profile 說明本 IG 如何進一步定義 FHIR 的 Immunization Resource 以呈現疫苗接種資料。

element.definition: 疫苗接種的記錄，包含接種的疫苗及事件的相關資訊。

constraint.human: If the resource is contained in another resource, it SHALL NOT contain nested Resources
If the resource is contained in another resource, it SHALL be referred to from elsewhere in the resource or SHALL refer to the containing resource
constraint.expression: contained.where((('#'+id in (%resource.descendants().reference | %resource.descendants().as(canonical) | %resource.descendants().as(uri) | %resource.descendants().as(url))) or descendants().where(reference = '#').exists() or descendants().where(as(canonical) = '#').exists() or descendants().where(as(canonical) = '#').exists()).not()).trace('unmatched', id).empty()
constraint.xpath: not(exists(for $id in f:contained/*/f:id/@value return $contained[not(parent::*/descendant::f:reference/@value=concat('#', $contained/*/id/@value) or descendant::f:reference[@value='#'])]))

constraint.human: If a resource is contained in another resource, it SHALL NOT have a meta.versionId or a meta.lastUpdated
If a resource is contained in another resource, it SHALL NOT have a security label

extension.valueMarkdown: When a resource has no narrative, only systems that fully understand the data can display the resource to a human safely. Including a human readable representation in the resource makes for a much more robust eco-system and cheaper handling of resources by intermediary systems. Some ecosystems restrict distribution of resources to only those systems that do fully understand the resources, and as a consequence implementers may believe that the narrative is superfluous. However experience shows that such eco-systems often open up to new participants over time.

constraint.human: A resource should have narrative for robust management
SHOULD have a translation to the NDC value set

element.definition: The logical id of the resource, as used in the URL for the resource. Once assigned, this value never changes.
element.comment: The only time that a resource does not have an id is when it is being submitted to the server using a create operation.

element.definition: The metadata about the resource. This is content that is maintained by the infrastructure. Changes to the content might not always be associated with version changes to the resource.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: 創建此內容所依據的一組規則
element.definition: 構建 resource 時遵循的一系列規則的參照，在處理內容時必須理解這些規則。通常這是對 IG 所定義之特殊規則及其他 profiles 的參照。
element.comment: Asserting this rule set restricts the content to be only understood by a limited set of trading partners. This inherently limits the usefulness of the data in the long term. However, the existing health eco-system is highly fractured, and not yet ready to define, collect, and exchange data in a generally computable sense. Wherever possible, implementers and/or specification writers should avoid using this element. Often, when used, the URL is a reference to an implementation guide that defines these special rules as part of it's narrative along with other profiles, value sets, etc.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.isModifierReason: This element is labeled as a modifier because the implicit rules may provide additional knowledge about the resource that modifies it's meaning or interpretation

element.definition: The base language in which the resource is written.
element.comment: Language is provided to support indexing and accessibility (typically, services such as text to speech use the language tag). The html language tag in the narrative applies  to the narrative. The language tag on the resource may be used to specify the language of other presentations generated from the data in the resource. Not all the content has to be in the base language. The Resource.language should not be assumed to apply to the narrative automatically. If a language is specified, it should it also be specified on the div element in the html (see rules in HTML5 for information about the relationship between xml:lang and the html lang attribute).

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: Text summary of the resource, for human interpretation
element.definition: A human-readable narrative that contains a summary of the resource and can be used to represent the content of the resource to a human. The narrative need not encode all the structured data, but is required to contain sufficient detail to make it "clinically safe" for a human to just read the narrative. Resource definitions may define what content should be represented in the narrative to ensure clinical safety.
element.comment: Contained resources do not have narrative. Resources that are not contained SHOULD have a narrative. In some cases, a resource may only have text with little or no additional discrete data (as long as all minOccurs=1 elements are satisfied).  This may be necessary for data from legacy systems where information is captured as a "text blob" or where text is additionally entered raw or narrated and encoded information is added later.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.definition: These resources do not have an independent existence apart from the resource that contains them - they cannot be identified independently, and nor can they have their own independent transaction scope.
element.comment: This should never be done when the content can be identified properly, as once identification is lost, it is extremely difficult (and context dependent) to restore it again. Contained resources may have profiles and tags In their meta elements, but SHALL NOT have security labels.

element.definition: May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the resource. To make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance  applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer can define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension.
element.comment: There can be no stigma associated with the use of extensions by any application, project, or standard - regardless of the institution or jurisdiction that uses or defines the extensions.  The use of extensions is what allows the FHIR specification to retain a core level of simplicity for everyone.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

element.short: 擴充內容可能會改變資源解釋方式
element.definition: 可以修改標準資源解釋的擴充內容。擴展內容通常會增加其他屬性，但不會更改基本解釋。在理解修改擴展內容之前不應該解釋此疫苗接種資源。

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

element.isModifierReason: Modifier extensions are expected to modify the meaning or interpretation of the resource that contains them

element.definition: A unique identifier assigned to this immunization record.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.definition: 疫苗接種事件的狀態，表示是否完成接種、記錄有誤或未接種。
element.comment: Will generally be set to show that the immunization has been completed or not done.  This element is labeled as a modifier because the status contains codes that mark the resource as not currently valid.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.isModifierReason: This element is labeled as a modifier because it is a status element that contains statuses entered-in-error and not-done which means that the resource should not be treated as valid

binding.description: A set of codes indicating the current status of an Immunization.

element.definition: 表示為什麼疫苗接種未完成的原因，例如：禁忌症、病患拒絕等。
element.comment: This is generally only used for the status of "not-done". The reason for performing the immunization event is captured in reasonCode, not here.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

binding.description: The reason why a vaccine was not administered.

element.short: 疫苗產品類型 (綁定到 CVX 疫苗代碼系統)
element.definition: 用於識別施打的疫苗種類或類型。

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.definition: 接受疫苗接種的患者參照。

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: 與疫苗接種相關的就醫事件
element.definition: 表示疫苗接種發生時的就醫事件參照。

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: 疫苗接種的發生日期/時間
element.definition: 疫苗接種發生的日期與時間，或以字串描述的大概時間。
element.comment: When immunizations are given a specific date and time should always be known.   When immunizations are patient reported, a specific date might not be known.  Although partial dates are allowed, an adult patient might not be able to recall the year a childhood immunization was given. An exact date is always preferable, but the use of the String data type is acceptable when an exact date is not known. A small number of vaccines (e.g. live oral typhoid vaccine) are given as a series of patient self-administered dose over a span of time. In cases like this, often, only the first dose (typically a provider supervised dose) is recorded with the occurrence indicating the date/time of the first dose.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: When the immunization was first captured in the subject's record
element.definition: The date the occurrence of the immunization was first captured in the record - potentially significantly after the occurrence of the event.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: 資料來源是否為主要來源
element.definition: 指示記錄的資訊是否來自主要來源 (如接種疫苗的人員)，或是從次要來源 (如病患本人回報) 取得。
element.comment: Reflects the “reliability” of the content.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: Indicates the source of a secondarily reported record
element.definition: The source of the data when the report of the immunization event is not based on information from the person who administered the vaccine.
element.comment: Should not be populated if primarySource = True, not required even if primarySource = False.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

binding.description: The source of the data for a record which is not from a primary source.

mapping.map: .participation[typeCode=INF].role[classCode=PAT] (this syntax for self-reported) .participation[typeCode=INF].role[classCode=LIC] (this syntax for health care professional) .participation[typeCode=INF].role[classCode=PRS] (this syntax for family member)

element.definition: 進行疫苗接種的實際地點，如醫療院所、診所等。

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

mapping.map: RXA-27  (or RXA-11, deprecated as of v2.7)

element.definition: 疫苗製造商的參照。

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.definition: Lot number of the  vaccine product.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.definition: Date vaccine batch expires.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.definition: Body site where vaccine was administered.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

binding.description: The site at which the vaccine was administered.

element.definition: The path by which the vaccine product is taken into the body.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

binding.description: The route by which the vaccine was administered.

element.definition: The quantity of vaccine product that was administered.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.definition: Indicates who performed the immunization event.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.definition: Unique id for the element within a resource (for internal references). This may be any string value that does not contain spaces.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

element.isModifierReason: Modifier extensions are expected to modify the meaning or interpretation of the element that contains them

element.short: What type of performance was done
element.definition: Describes the type of performance (e.g. ordering provider, administering provider, etc.).

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

binding.description: The role a practitioner or organization plays in the immunization event.

element.short: 執行疫苗接種的人員或組織
element.definition: 參與疫苗接種的醫療人員、醫療人員角色或組織的參照。
element.comment: When the individual practitioner who performed the action is known, it is best to send.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.definition: Extra information about the immunization that is not conveyed by the other attributes.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.definition: Reasons why the vaccine was administered.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

binding.description: The reason why a vaccine was administered.

element.definition: 進行此次疫苗接種的醫療原因參照，例如：特定疾病、臨床觀察或診斷報告。

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: 疫苗效價是否低於標準
element.definition: 表明接種的疫苗劑量是否已知低於建議量的標示，例如：部分劑量因患者移動而造成施打不完整、或完整劑量分成多次施打。
element.comment: Typically, the recognition of the dose being sub-potent is retrospective, after the administration (ex. notification of a manufacturer recall after administration). However, in the case of a partial administration (the patient moves unexpectedly and only some of the dose is actually administered), subpotency may be recognized immediately, but it is still important to record the event.
element.meaningWhenMissing: By default, a dose should be considered to be potent.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.isModifierReason: This element is labeled as a modifier because an immunization event with a subpotent vaccine doesn't protect the patient the same way as a potent dose.

element.definition: Reason why a dose is considered to be subpotent.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

binding.description: The reason why a dose is considered to be subpotent.

element.definition: Educational material presented to the patient (or guardian) at the time of vaccine administration.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
One of documentType or reference SHALL be present

element.definition: Identifier of the material presented to the patient.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.definition: Reference pointer to the educational material given to the patient if the information was on line.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.definition: Date the educational material was published.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.definition: Date the educational material was given to the patient.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: Patient eligibility for a vaccination program
element.definition: Indicates a patient's eligibility for a funding program.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

binding.description: The patient's eligibility for a vaccation program.

element.definition: Indicates the source of the vaccine actually administered. This may be different than the patient eligibility (e.g. the patient may be eligible for a publically purchased vaccine but due to inventory issues, vaccine purchased with private funds was actually administered).

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

binding.description: The source of funding used to purchase the vaccine administered.

element.short: Details of a reaction that follows immunization
element.definition: Categorical data indicating that an adverse event is associated in time to an immunization.
element.comment: A reaction may be an indication of an allergy or intolerance and, if this is determined to be the case, it should be recorded as a new AllergyIntolerance resource instance as most systems will not query against past Immunization.reaction elements.

element.definition: 疫苗接種後發生的不良反應參照，例如：過敏反應、發燒等臨床結果觀察。

element.definition: One possible path to achieve presumed immunity against a disease - within the context of an authority.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: 疫苗接種計劃的權責組織
element.definition: 提供或授權此疫苗接種計劃的組織參照。

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.definition: The vaccine preventable disease the dose is being administered against.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

binding.description: The vaccine preventable disease the dose is being administered for.

element.definition: Nominal position in a series.
element.comment: The use of an integer is preferred if known. A string should only be used in cases where an integer is not available (such as when documenting a recurring booster dose).

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: Recommended number of doses for immunity
element.definition: The recommended number of doses to achieve immunity.
element.comment: The use of an integer is preferred if known. A string should only be used in cases where an integer is not available (such as when documenting a recurring booster dose).

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.definition: 疫苗接種的記錄，包含接種的疫苗及事件的相關資訊。

element.definition: 構建 resource 時遵循的一系列規則的參照，在處理內容時必須理解這些規則。通常這是對 IG 所定義之特殊規則及其他 profiles 的參照。

element.short: 擴充內容可能會改變資源解釋方式
element.definition: 可以修改標準資源解釋的擴充內容。擴展內容通常會增加其他屬性，但不會更改基本解釋。在理解修改擴展內容之前不應該解釋此疫苗接種資源。
疫苗接種事件的狀態，表示是否完成接種、記錄有誤或未接種。
表示為什麼疫苗接種未完成的原因，例如：禁忌症、病患拒絕等。

element.short: 疫苗產品類型 (綁定到 CVX 疫苗代碼系統)
element.definition: 用於識別施打的疫苗種類或類型。
接受疫苗接種的患者參照。

element.short: 與疫苗接種相關的就醫事件
element.definition: 表示疫苗接種發生時的就醫事件參照。

element.short: 疫苗接種的發生日期/時間
element.definition: 疫苗接種發生的日期與時間，或以字串描述的大概時間。

element.short: 資料來源是否為主要來源
element.definition: 指示記錄的資訊是否來自主要來源 (如接種疫苗的人員)，或是從次要來源 (如病患本人回報) 取得。
進行疫苗接種的實際地點，如醫療院所、診所等。
疫苗製造商的參照。

element.short: 執行疫苗接種的人員或組織
element.definition: 參與疫苗接種的醫療人員、醫療人員角色或組織的參照。
進行此次疫苗接種的醫療原因參照，例如：特定疾病、臨床觀察或診斷報告。

element.short: 疫苗效價是否低於標準
element.definition: 表明接種的疫苗劑量是否已知低於建議量的標示，例如：部分劑量因患者移動而造成施打不完整、或完整劑量分成多次施打。
疫苗接種後發生的不良反應參照，例如：過敏反應、發燒等臨床結果觀察。

element.short: 疫苗接種計劃的權責組織
element.definition: 提供或授權此疫苗接種計劃的組織參照。
